intro: Alguelaguen sprucei, commonly known as the Andean spruce, is a coniferous tree native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its needle-like leaves and cone-bearing structure typical of the Pinaceae family. The tree thrives in cool, moist climates and is often found in cloud forests. Its bark is thick and fissured, providing protection against harsh environmental conditions. Alguelaguen sprucei plays an important ecological role in its native habitat by supporting local biodiversity and contributing to soil stability.
